page.title: 17FIRE STATION
page.content: Ixworth, like many rural communities is not big enough to support a full-time fire service. One fire engine is stationed permanently in the village. When the alarm is raised - usually by a person dialling 999 on a telephone - the operator causes a radio signal to be transmitted.11 retained (part-time) firemen carry a small pocket receiver which makes a 'bleeping' sound. When alerted they immediately rush to the fire station, where, having noted the details they hurry to the scene. They aim to be mobile within two minutes. Another engine is sent from Elmswell or Bury. The first to arrive saves life, the second, property. A crew of 4 is the minimum required. The most difficult time to obtain a crew is during the day when half the men are working out of the village.Two teachers from the Middle School are firemen.
